lines.text: So where are you folks from?
The East.
Oh, New York, huh?
Further east.

[singing]
A hundred million miracles, a hundred million miracles are happening every day, / And those who say they don't agree are those who do not hear or see. / A hundred million miracles, a hundred million miracles are happening every day.

[singing]
I'm a girl and by me that's only great, I am proud that my silhouette is curvy. / That I walk with a sweet and girlish gait with my hips kind of swively and swirly. / I enjoy being dressed in something frilly when my date comes to get me at my place, / Out I go with my Joe or John or Billy like a filly who is ready for the race. / When I have a brand new hairdo with my eye lashes all in curl, / I float as the clouds on air do, I enjoy being a girl. / When men say I'm cute and funny and my teeth aren't teeth but pearl, / I just lap it out like honey, I enjoy being a girl. / I flip when a fellow sends me flowers, I drool over dresses made of lace, / I talk on the telephone for hours with a pound and a half of cream upon my face. / I'm strictly a female female and my future I hope will be / In the home of a brave and free male who'll enjoy being a guy having a girl like me.
"This is not China!".
What did he look like?
Who?
The robber.
Dont ask me what he looked like! All white men look alike!

[Cursing the newspaper editor for not publishing his "Letter to the Editor"]
Son of a turtle!
This is not China. This is a different world. And here a man has the right to choose his own wife.
And here he also has the right to get divorced every year and pick a new one.
What language is he using? I have a feeling he has been disrespectful, but I am not sure.
No, no. That is American style slang.

[singing]
What are we going to do about the other generation? / How will we ever communicate without communication?

[to Wang Chi-Yang]
This is beautiful and very outspoken.
And are you also proud of this fine American citizen in your family, Master Wong?
To become an American citizen it took her five years. She was Chinese in nine months.
I am happy to be both Chinese and American.
You are like the Chinese dish the Americans invented. What do they call it?
Chop Suey.
That is it. Everything is in it. All mixed up.
I like that.
[singing]
Chop Suey. Chop Suey. / Living here is very much like Chop Suey. / Hula-hoops and nucelar war, Doctor Salk and Zsa Zsa Gabor, / Bobby Darin, Sandra Dee and Dewey, Chop Suey.
Chop Suey!

[singing]
You be the rock.

[singing]
I be the roll.

[singing]
You be the soup.

[singing]
I be the bowl.

[singing]
You be the furnace.

[singing]
I'll be the coal.

[singing]
Rock, rock, rock, roll, roll, roll.

[to Wang Ta]
When that day come when you can think for yourself, I will let you know.

[singing]
I am talking like a Chinese uncle / I'm as serious as I can be. / I am saying this because I love you / Darling, don't marry me.
Oh yes, I like it. Especially I like.

[singing]
Fan Tan Fanny was leaving her man, / Fan Tan Fanny kept waiving her fan, / Said "Goodbye Danny, you two timing Dan", / Some other man loves your little Fanny. Bye! Bye! / In the icebox you'll find in a can / Some leftovers of Moo Goo Gai Pan. / Fan Tan Fanny has found a new guy, / His name is Manny, he's good for Fanny, / So goodbye, Danny, goodbye! / Bye! Bye!
You smell good. You wear incense to scare away evil spirits?
Oh no, to attract them!

[as Wang San runs from his brother's bedroom]
Wait! Why aren't you in school?
It's Saturday!
Always some excuse!

[about Linda]
She's okay! She came into this country the regular way; through her mother!

[to Sammy Fong]
You have an unfortunate way of expressing yourself.
[first lines]

[in Chinese]
What was that?

[in Chinese]
I don't know. Must be my stomach.

[to the people]
Kind hearted and distinguished friends. My daughter and I are going to give a show. A Flower Drum show from the north.

[to Mei Lee]
Okay, kid. Okay, I'll get you all you can eat.
Baby, you remember the new convertible you've been drooling over? Well it's yours.
I don't want it.
I need some money.
Money. That is nothing unusual. How much this time?
Twenty five bucks.
Bucks?
Dollars.

[singing]
What are we going to do about the other generation? / How will we ever communicate without communication / When we are using words the modern way?
No, no, no. Everybody, everybody, back, back. The gentleman made a mistake. Mister.
My sister's husband.
My congratulations! This is indeed an excellent system!

[to the graduation party]
With a Do See Do. Promenade. Waltz the hall. Everybody have a ball.
Would you like to dance?
I don't know how, but I will walk around with you while you dance.

[singing]
Grant Avenue, San Francisco, California, U.S.A. / Looks down from Chinatown over a foggy bay./ You travel there in a trolley, in a trolley there up you climb. / Dong! Dong! You're in Hong Kong, having yourself a time. / You can eat, if you are in the mood.

[singing]
Shark-fin soup, bean cake fish.

[singing]
The girl who serves you all your food is another tasty dish.

[singing]
You know you.

[singing]
You can't have a new way of living till you're living all the way on / Grand Avenue.
Where's that?

[singing]
San Francisco. That's where's that! California USA.

[singing]
That's how I see them, gliding through my memoree.

[singing]
Love, look away! Love, look away from me. /Fly, when you pass my door, fly and get lost at sea. / Call it a day. Love, let us say we're through. / No good for you are me, no good am I for you. / Wanting you so, I try too much. / After you go, I cry too much. / Love, look away. Lonely though I may be, / Leave me and set me free, / Look away, look away, look away from me.
Where have you been till this hour?
Spending the night...
Stop! Not in front of your aunt.
I beg your forgiveness, Father. I should have listened. I was a fool.
Knowing you are a fool is the beginning of wisdom. Now I have my son back.
Stick em up!

[singing]
You are beautiful, small and shy.

[singing]
Sunday, sweet Sunday, you will only see only me.
Here, they're not really married until they seal it with a kiss.
Everything in America ends in a kiss. What does it mean? Why do they do it?
Maestro please...
Very pretty.
How do I look?
[last lines]

[singing]
A hundred million miracles.

[singing]
A hundred million miracles.

[singing]
A hundred million miracles. a hundred million miracles are happening everyday.

[singing]
A little girl in Chunking, just thirty inches tall, / Decides that she will try to walk and nearly doesn't fall! / A hundred million miracles! / A hundred million miracles, a hundred million miracles, a hundred million miracles are happening every day.
